messages.content:
वांझ म्हणजे फळांचा विकास न झालेला किंवा फळे न येणारा अवस्थेत असलेला वेल किंवा झाड. यामध्ये फळांची वाढ किंवा उत्पादन कमी असते. 

तुमच्या वेलांमध्ये वांझपणा येण्याची कारणे खालीलप्रमाणे असू शकतात:

1. **अयोग्य पोषण**: योग्य खतांचा वापर न केल्यास.
2. **पाण्याची कमतरता**: योग्य प्रमाणात पाणी न मिळाल्यास.
3. **किडे आणि रोग**: किडे किंवा रोगांचा प्रादुर्भाव.
4. **अयोग्य हवामान**: तापमान किंवा आर्द्रता योग्य नसल्यास.

तुमच्या वेलांमध्ये वांझपणा असल्यास, योग्य उपाययोजना करणे आवश्यक आहे. तुम्हाला अधिक माहिती हवी असल्यास, कृपया सांगा.

messages.content:
पाऊस झाल्यावर स्प्रे घेण्याची योग्य वेळ म्हणजे पाऊस थांबल्यानंतर आणि जमिनीवरील ओलावा कमी झाल्यावर. यामुळे स्प्रे अधिक प्रभावीपणे कार्य करतो. 

तुमच्या प्लॉटसाठी स्प्रे करण्याची सर्वोत्तम वेळ म्हणजे:

1. **सकाळी**: सूर्य उगवण्याच्या आधी किंवा उगवण्याच्या नंतर, जेव्हा तापमान कमी असते.
2. **दुपारी**: तापमान कमी असले तरी, पाऊस झाल्यानंतर काही तासांनी.
3. **संध्याकाळी**: तापमान कमी झाल्यावर, जेव्हा वारा कमी असतो.

तुमच्या प्लॉटसाठी योग्य स्प्रे परिस्थिती तपासण्यासाठी, मी तुम्हाला स्प्रे परिस्थितीची माहिती देऊ शकतो. तुम्हाला हे करायचे आहे का?

tools:
check_spray_conditions  
Gets the spray condition forecast for the next few hours for the farmer's plots and returns the condition for each hour as GOOD, MODERATE, or WORST, based on deltaT, VPD, and rainfall conditions.

get_disease_pest_schedule  
Retrieves the farmer's current and past pesticide-related spray recommendations with spray details, based on dates. Dates are mandatory.
faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: I already took spray for this pest, but it is still showing high prediction/chances, why?
A: Taking a spray does not affect the prediction calculation. If you have already sprayed based on the fyllo notification,
   then wait a few days, if the fyllo app still recommends spray, only then spray again. Don't give any other reasons.

messages.content:
तुमच्या प्लॉटसाठी स्प्रे परिस्थिती खालीलप्रमाणे आहे:

### Anushka प्लॉट:
- **आज रात्री 10:30**: WORST (पाऊसामुळे परिस्थिती योग्य नाही)
- **आज रात्री 11:30**: WORST
- **उद्या पहाटे 12:30**: WORST
- **उद्या पहाटे 1:30**: MODERATE (पाऊस थांबला आहे, पण वाऱ्याची स्थिती चांगली नाही)
- **उद्या पहाटे 2:30**: WORST
- **उद्या पहाटे 3:30**: WORST
- **उद्या पहाटे 4:30**: WORST
- **उद्या पहाटे 5:30**: WORST
- **उद्या पहाटे 6:30**: WORST
- **उद्या पहाटे 7:30**: WORST
- **उद्या पहाटे 8:30**: WORST
- **उद्या सकाळी 9:30**: WORST
- **उद्या सकाळी 10:30**: WORST
- **उद्या सकाळी 11:30**: WORST
- **उद्या सकाळी 12:30**: WORST

### Manikchaman प्लॉट:
- स्प्रे परिस्थिती तपासण्यात अयशस्वी.

**सारांश**: Anushka प्लॉटसाठी आज रात्री आणि उद्या पहाटे स्प्रे करण्याची स्थिती WORST आहे. तुम्ही उद्या पहाटे 1:30 च्या सुमारास MODERATE स्थितीत स्प्रे करू शकता, पण वाऱ्याची स्थिती चांगली नसल्यामुळे काळजी घ्या. Manikchaman प्लॉटसाठी स्प्रे परिस्थिती तपासता आलेली नाही.

messages.standalone_question: What does "Phi" mean?
messages.standalone_en: What does "Phi" mean?

messages.content:
"Phi" (Φ) हा एक गणितीय संज्ञा आहे, जो विशेषतः गणित, भौतिकशास्त्र, आणि इतर विज्ञानांमध्ये वापरला जातो. याचा अर्थ "गोल्डन रेशो" (Golden Ratio) किंवा "गोल्डन संख्या" (Golden Number) आहे, जो 1.6180339887... च्या सुमारे असतो. 

गोल्डन रेशो हा एक विशेष अनुपात आहे जो निसर्गात, आर्किटेक्चरमध्ये, आणि कला मध्ये दिसून येतो. याला "गोल्डन रेशो" म्हणून ओळखले जाते कारण याचा उपयोग अनेक सुंदर रचनांमध्ये केला जातो.

तुम्हाला "Phi" विषयी अधिक माहिती हवी असल्यास, कृपया सांगा!

messages.content:
फ्लावरिंग के दौरान कुछ महत्वपूर्ण उपाय हैं जो आप अपने अंगूरों के पौधों के लिए कर सकते हैं:

1. **पोषण**: पौधों को सही मात्रा में नाइट्रोजन, फास्फोरस और पोटेशियम दें। फास्फोरस विशेष रूप से फूलों के विकास के लिए महत्वपूर्ण है।

2. **सिंचाई**: मिट्टी की नमी का ध्यान रखें। अधिक पानी देने से बचें, क्योंकि यह फूलों के विकास को प्रभावित कर सकता है। 

3. **कीट नियंत्रण**: कीटों और बीमारियों की निगरानी करें। यदि कोई समस्या हो, तो उचित कीटनाशक का उपयोग करें।

4. **प्रकाश**: सुनिश्चित करें कि पौधों को पर्याप्त धूप मिल रही है। फूलों के लिए 6-8 घंटे की धूप आवश्यक है।

5. **छंटाई**: पौधों की छंटाई करें ताकि वे स्वस्थ और मजबूत रहें। 

6. **फर्टिलाइज़ेशन**: फूलों के विकास के लिए विशेष फर्टिलाइज़र का उपयोग करें।

इन उपायों का पालन करने से आपके पौधों में बेहतर फूल आने की संभावना बढ़ जाएगी।

messages.content:
**प्लॉट नं. 1 (क्लोन) साठी उपाययोजना:**

1. **अँथ्रॅक्नोज:**
   - प्रभावित भागांना तात्काळ कापा आणि नष्ट करा.
   - फफूंदनाशकांचा वापर करा, जसे की **कॅप्टन** किंवा **फ्लुकोनाझोल**.
   - पाण्याचा योग्य निचरा सुनिश्चित करा, कारण ओलावा अँथ्रॅक्नोजच्या वाढीसाठी अनुकूल आहे.

2. **पावडरी मिल्ड्यू:**
   - फफूंदनाशकांचा वापर करा, जसे की **बायोफंडल** किंवा **सायक्लोहेक्सिमाइड**.
   - पाण्याचा योग्य निचरा सुनिश्चित करा.
   - पानांच्या ओलाव्यात कमी करण्यासाठी पाण्याची फवारणी कमी करा.

3. **डाऊनी मिल्ड्यू:**
   - प्रभावित भागांना कापा आणि नष्ट करा.
   - फफूंदनाशकांचा वापर करा, जसे की **मेटालॅक्सिल**.
   - पाण्याचा योग्य निचरा सुनिश्चित करा.

**सामान्य उपाययोजना:**
- नियमितपणे पानांची तपासणी करा.
- पाण्याची फवारणी संध्याकाळी किंवा सकाळी करा, जेणेकरून पाण्याचा ओलावा कमी होईल.
- योग्य वायुवीजन सुनिश्चित करा.

कृपया या उपाययोजनांचा तात्काळ अवलंब करा आणि आपल्या पिकांचे आरोग्य राखा.

messages.content:
For controlling flea beetles, you can use the following insecticides:

1. **Imidacloprid** - Apply at a rate of 0.5 to 1.0 ml per liter of water.
2. **Carbaryl** - Use at a rate of 1.5 to 2.0 gm per liter of water.
3. **Pyrethroids** (like Lambda-cyhalothrin) - Apply according to the manufacturer's instructions.

Make sure to follow the recommended application rates and safety precautions while using these insecticides.

faq:
Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

tools:
get_irrigation_forecast  
Gives the irrigation requirement forecast for any day, today and beyond. Dates are mandatory. Output is humanized with day of the week and optimal moisture details if suitable.

get_hourly_weather_forecast  
Provides hourly weather forecast for today and the next 4 days for the farmer's plots. Use only for forecast, not actual measured values.

check_spray_conditions  
Gets the spray condition forecast for the next few hours for the farmer's plots and returns the condition for each hour as GOOD, MODERATE, or WORST, based on deltaT, VPD, and rainfall conditions.

get_irrigation_installation_settings
    retrieves the irrigation installation settings in the farmer's plots, can be used to calculate the irrigation hours.
    returns root_width, root_depth, soil_retention, dripper_distance, dripper_discharge

get_daily_weather_forecast  
Provides the next 14 days from today, daily weather forecast for the farmer's plots. Use only for forecast, not current values.

Q: How to measure/ calculate irrigation hours /water tank of my plot in fyllo app? How do I calculate irrigation hours for my plot? How to use the irrigation hours calculator?
A: To calculate irrigation hours in the Fyllo app, follow these steps:

1. Open the Fyllo App
2. Go to the home screen
3. Click on the soil moisture-1 sensor
4. Scroll down to find the "Irrigation hours" section
5. Fill in the required details such as:
   - Root width (inches)
   - Root depth (inches)
   - Soil retention (mm)
   - Dripper distance (feet)
   - Dripper discharge (liters)
6. Click the calculate button

Would you like me to calculate the irrigation hours for you right now? I can retrieve your plot's irrigation settings and perform the calculation if you say yes.

Tool Selection: When user says yes, I should:
1. Use get_irrigation_installation_settings tool to retrieve plot settings
2. Check if all values are present and valid
3. If values are valid, use calculate_irrigation_hours tool with these values
4. If values are missing or invalid, ask the user to provide the missing values
5. After calculating irrigation hours, display the irrigation installation settings that were used for the calculation
6. Ask the user if they want to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values, and if yes, prompt them to provide those values

Example response if values are missing:
"I checked your plot settings, but I need some additional information to calculate irrigation hours accurately. Could you please provide the [missing value(s)]? Once you provide these details, I can complete the calculation for you."

Example response after calculation:
"Based on your plot's irrigation settings, the calculated irrigation hours are [X] hours. 

I used the following settings for this calculation:
- Root width: [value] inches
- Root depth: [value] inches
- Soil retention: [value] mm
- Dripper distance: [value] feet
- Dripper discharge: [value] liters

Would you like to calculate irrigation hours with a different set of values? If yes, please provide the new values you'd like to use."

messages.content:
Aapke crop image analysis ke anusar, aapke pepper ke paudhe ki health "unhealthy" hai. Yahan kuch mukhya baatein hain:

### Diagnosis:
- **Magnesium Deficiency**: Yeh bahut sambhavit hai.
  
### Symptoms:
- Patton par pale green spots ya yellowing, jo margin se shuru hote hain.
- Mukhy patte ke veins hamesha green rehte hain.
- Patton par reddish ya brown spots dikhai dete hain.
- Sukhe patte ka tissue mar jaata hai.

### Treatment:
- Magnesium (Mg) wale fertilizers ka istemal karein, jaise magnesium oxide ya magnesium sulphate (MgSO4).
- Apne kheti ke advisor se sampark karein taaki aapke mitti aur paudhe ke liye sahi product aur dosage pata chale.

### Additional Recommendations:
- Kheti season shuru hone se pehle soil test karana behtar rahega taaki aapki crop production optimize ho sake.
- Magnesium ko seedhe mitti par ya foliar sprays ke saath apply kiya ja sakta hai.

Agar aapko aur madad chahiye, toh bataiye!

messages.content:
Aapke crop image analysis ke anusar, aapke pepper ke paudhe ki health "unhealthy" hai. Yahan kuch mukhya baatein hain:

### Diagnosis:
1. **Magnesium Deficiency** (Sambhavit)
   - **Symptoms**:
     - Patton par pale green spots ya yellowing, jo margin se shuru hote hain.
     - Mukhy patte ke veins hamesha green rehte hain.
     - Patton par reddish ya brown spots dikhai dete hain.
     - Sukhe patte ka tissue mar jaata hai.
   - **Treatment**:
     - Magnesium (Mg) wale fertilizers ka istemal karein, jaise magnesium oxide ya magnesium sulphate (MgSO4).
     - Apne kheti ke advisor se sampark karein taaki aapke mitti aur paudhe ke liye sahi product aur dosage pata chale.

2. **Potassium Deficiency** (Aasambhavit)
   - **Symptoms**:
     - Patton ki margins se yellowing shuru hoti hai.
     - Mukhy veins dark green rehte hain.
     - Patte curl hote hain aur growth stunted hoti hai.
   - **Treatment**:
     - Potassium (K) wale fertilizers ka istemal karein, jaise muriate of potash (MOP) ya potassium nitrate (KNO3).
     - Fertilizers ko field preparation aur flowering ke dauran apply karna behtar hota hai.

3. **Bacterial Spot of Pepper** (Bahut Aasambhavit)
   - **Symptoms**:
     - Young leaves par chhote yellow-green lesions.
     - Older foliage par dark, water-soaked lesions.
     - Patton ki deformed aur twisted appearance.
   - **Treatment**:
     - Integrated approach ke saath preventive measures aur biological treatments ka istemal karein. Copper-containing bactericides ka istemal kiya ja sakta hai.

### Additional Recommendations:
- Kheti season shuru hone se pehle soil test karana behtar rahega taaki aapki crop production optimize ho sake.

Agar aapko aur madad chahiye, toh bataiye!

messages.content:
फायलो ॲपमध्ये अमोनियम सल्फेटचा ऑप्शन न मिळाल्यास, तुम्ही खालील फवारणी पर्यायांचा विचार करू शकता:

1. **युरिया**: युरिया एक सामान्य नायट्रोजन खत आहे, जे पिकांच्या वाढीसाठी उपयुक्त आहे.
2. **डीएपी (Diammonium Phosphate)**: यामध्ये नायट्रोजन आणि फॉस्फरस दोन्ही असतात, जे पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी आवश्यक आहे.
3. **फोलिअर स्प्रे**: पिकांच्या पानांवर फोलिअर स्प्रे करून नायट्रोजन मिळवता येतो. 

तुमच्या पिकाच्या विशेष गरजेनुसार योग्य फवारणी निवडणे महत्त्वाचे आहे. जर तुम्हाला अधिक माहिती हवी असेल, तर कृपया तुमच्या पिकाच्या सध्याच्या अवस्थेची माहिती द्या.
सुरुवातीचे चार महिने गर्भधारणे पर्यंत बोरॉन कोणत्या फॉर्ममध्ये द्यावे? चिलेटेड की ऑक्साडाईज फॉर्म

गर्भधारणेच्या सुरुवातीच्या चार महिन्यांमध्ये बोरॉन चा वापर चिलेटेड फॉर्ममध्ये करणे अधिक प्रभावी असते. चिलेटेड बोरॉन पिकांच्या मुळांद्वारे अधिक चांगल्या प्रकारे शोषला जातो आणि त्यामुळे पिकांच्या वाढीसाठी आवश्यक पोषण मिळवतो. 

ऑक्साडाईज फॉर्म कमी प्रभावी असू शकतो, कारण तो मातीतील उपलब्धतेवर अवलंबून असतो. त्यामुळे चिलेटेड बोरॉनचा वापर करणे अधिक फायदेशीर ठरते.

1. **निसवणीच्या अगोदर**: फॉस्फरिक ऍसिड वापरल्याने मातीतील फॉस्फरसची उपलब्धता वाढते, ज्यामुळे पिकांच्या मुळांच्या विकासास मदत होते.

2. **निसवणीच्या नंतर**: निसवणीच्या नंतर फॉस्फरिक ऍसिड वापरल्याने पिकांच्या वाढीला चालना मिळते आणि फळांच्या विकासात सुधारणा होते.

होय, युरिया पेक्षा अमोनियम सल्फेट दिले तरी चालेल, विशेषतः केळीच्या पिकांसाठी. अमोनियम सल्फेटमध्ये नायट्रोजन आणि सल्फर दोन्ही असतात, जे पिकांच्या वाढीसाठी आवश्यक आहेत. 

अमोनियम सल्फेटचा वापर केल्याने:

1. **नायट्रोजनची उपलब्धता**: पिकांना आवश्यक नायट्रोजन मिळतो, ज्यामुळे पिकांची वाढ सुधारते.
2. **सल्फरची उपलब्धता**: सल्फर मुळांच्या विकासासाठी आणि फळांच्या गुणवत्तेसाठी महत्त्वाचा आहे.

तथापि, अमोनियम सल्फेटचा वापर करताना, मातीच्या pH स्तराचा विचार करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे, कारण यामुळे मातीची अम्लता वाढू शकते. त्यामुळे योग्य प्रमाणात आणि वेळेत वापर करणे आवश्यक आहे.
नायट्रोजन चे प्रमाण केळी किती दिले पाहिजे, सुरुवातीपासून ते हार्वेस्टिंग पर्यंत?

messages.content:
केळीच्या पिकांसाठी नायट्रोजनचे प्रमाण सुरुवातीपासून हार्वेस्टिंगपर्यंत खालीलप्रमाणे असावे:

1. **सुरुवात (सिंचन व स्थापन)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
2. **प्रारंभिक वाढ (1-3 महिने)**: 50-100 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
3. **मध्यम वाढ (3-6 महिने)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
4. **ग्रँड ग्रोथ फेज (6-9 महिने)**: 150-200 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
5. **फळ विकास (9-12 महिने)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
6. **हार्वेस्टिंगपूर्वी**: 50-100 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर

एकूण, केळीच्या पिकासाठी 400-600 किग्रॅ नायट्रोजन प्रति हेक्टेअर आवश्यक असते. हे प्रमाण पिकाच्या अवस्थेनुसार आणि मातीच्या पोषणाच्या गरजेनुसार समायोजित करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे. 

तुमच्या मातीच्या विशिष्ट गरजेनुसार आणि पिकाच्या अवस्थेनुसार योग्य प्रमाणात नायट्रोजन देणे आवश्यक आहे.

messages.content:
होय, केळीच्या पिकांवर गॅलिलिओ फवारणी करणे उपयुक्त ठरू शकते, विशेषतः जेव्हा पिकांमध्ये घड आलेले असतात. गॅलिलिओ एक प्रकारचे फोलिअर खत आहे, जे पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी आणि वाढीसाठी आवश्यक पोषण प्रदान करते.

फवारणी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **सही प्रमाण**: गॅलिलिओचे प्रमाण योग्य प्रमाणात वापरा, जेणेकरून पिकांना आवश्यक पोषण मिळेल.
2. **फवारणीची वेळ**: सकाळी किंवा संध्याकाळी फवारणी करणे अधिक प्रभावी असते, कारण त्या वेळी तापमान कमी असते.
3. **आवश्यकता**: पिकांच्या विशेष गरजेनुसार फवारणी करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

तुमच्या पिकाच्या स्थितीनुसार आणि गरजेनुसार गॅलिलिओ फवारणी करणे उपयुक्त ठरू शकते.

होय, जर प्लॉटवर तापमान जास्त असेल आणि तुम्ही बेन ऑइलची फवारणी केली, तर त्याने स्कॉर्चिंग होण्याची शक्यता असते. उच्च तापमानामुळे पानांवर फवारलेले तेल वाष्पीकरण होऊ शकते, ज्यामुळे पानांवर जळणारे किंवा स्कॉर्चिंगचे लक्षणे दिसू शकतात.

फवारणी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **तापमान**: उच्च तापमानात फवारणी टाळा, विशेषतः दुपारी.
2. **फवारणीची वेळ**: सकाळी किंवा संध्याकाळी फवारणी करणे अधिक सुरक्षित असते.
3. **पाण्याचा वापर**: बेन ऑइलसह पाण्याचे प्रमाण योग्य प्रमाणात ठेवा, जेणेकरून पानांवर जास्त ताण येणार नाही.

तुमच्या पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी योग्य काळजी घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

messages.content:
ब्लॅक स्प्लीटींग (Black Splitting) हे एक बुरशीजन्य रोग आहे, जो मुख्यतः केळीच्या पिकांमध्ये आढळतो. हा रोग फळांच्या बाह्य आवरणावर काळ्या धब्बे किंवा फाटे निर्माण करतो, ज्यामुळे फळांची गुणवत्ता कमी होते आणि बाजारात विक्रीसाठी अयोग्य ठरतात.

### व्यवस्थापन:

1. **साफसफाई**: शेतातील मृत किंवा संक्रमित पानं आणि फळं काढून टाका, जेणेकरून रोगाचा प्रसार थांबेल.

2. **सुरक्षित फवारणी**: बुरशीजन्य रोगांवर नियंत्रण ठेवण्यासाठी योग्य बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर करा. फवारणी करताना तापमान आणि आर्द्रता यांचा विचार करा.

3. **पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन**: पाण्याची योग्य मात्रा आणि वेळेवर सिंचन करा. ओलसर वातावरणामुळे रोगाचा प्रसार होऊ शकतो.

4. **पिकांची निवड**: रोग प्रतिकारक केळीच्या जातींचा वापर करा, जेणेकरून रोगाचा प्रभाव कमी होईल.

5. **पोषण व्यवस्थापन**: पिकांना आवश्यक पोषण देणे महत्त्वाचे आहे, जेणेकरून ते रोगांवर अधिक प्रतिकार करू शकतील.

6. **संपूर्ण निरीक्षण**: पिकांची नियमितपणे तपासणी करा, जेणेकरून रोगाची लक्षणे लवकर ओळखता येतील.

या उपाययोजनांचा अवलंब करून तुम्ही ब्लॅक स्प्लीटींगच्या प्रभावी व्यवस्थापनात मदत करू शकता.

messages.content:
केळीच्या पिकात **बूटिंग स्टेज** साधारणतः फळांच्या विकासाच्या प्रक्रियेत येते, जेव्हा फळांचे बूट तयार होतात. या स्टेजमध्ये योग्य व्यवस्थापन करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

### बूटिंग स्टेज कधी सबमिट करायची:
बूटिंग स्टेज साधारणतः केळीच्या पिकाच्या **ग्रँड ग्रोथ फेज** नंतर येते. तुम्ही बूटिंग स्टेजची तयारी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **तपशीलवार निरीक्षण**: पिकांच्या वाढीवर लक्ष ठेवा आणि बूटिंग स्टेजच्या सुरुवातीच्या लक्षणांची ओळख करा.
2. **सही वेळ**: बूटिंग स्टेज साधारणतः 9-12 महिन्यांच्या दरम्यान येते, त्यामुळे तुम्ही या कालावधीत व्यवस्थापन करणे सुरू करा.

### बूटिंग स्टेजचे व्यवस्थापन:
1. **पोषण व्यवस्थापन**: 
   - फॉस्फरस आणि पोटॅशियमचे प्रमाण वाढवा, जे फळांच्या विकासासाठी आवश्यक आहे.
   - योग्य खतांचा वापर करा, जसे की DAP किंवा MOP.

2. **पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन**: 
   - सिंचनाची योग्य मात्रा ठेवा, कारण या स्टेजमध्ये पाण्याची गरज वाढते.
   - ओलसर वातावरण टाळा, जेणेकरून बुरशीजन्य रोगांचा प्रसार होणार नाही.

3. **रोग नियंत्रण**: 
   - बुरशीजन्य रोगांवर नियंत्रण ठेवण्यासाठी योग्य बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर करा.
   - पिकांची नियमितपणे तपासणी करा.

4. **फळांची काळजी**: 
   - फळांच्या बूटिंगच्या वेळी पिकांची काळजी घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे, त्यामुळे फळांची गुणवत्ता सुधारते.

5. **सुरक्षितता**: 
   - पिकांच्या आजारांपासून संरक्षण करण्यासाठी योग्य उपाययोजना करा.

या सर्व गोष्टींचा विचार करून तुम्ही बूटिंग स्टेजमध्ये केळीच्या पिकाचे व्यवस्थापन प्रभावीपणे करू शकता.

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.

get_optimal_soil_moistures  
Retrieves the optimal soil moisture values in kPa or percentage above which to irrigate for all plots. 0 kPa means wet, 200 kPa means dry soil. In percentage: 0% means dry, 100% means wet. In percentage values, irrigate when below the optimum range.

get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".
faq:
Q: In the latest irrigation , sensor didn't drop to 0.
A: 0 to 5 Kpa means soil is fully wet. It need not drop to 0 every time. Moisture less than 5 also means wet conditions. So, need not worry. Also ask to wait for 12 hours after irrigation.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows wet values?
A: Verify the irrigation frequency, check the installation point, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

2.	When should the Booting stage be submitted?
messages.standalone_question: When should the booting stage be submitted?
messages.standalone_en: When should the booting stage be submitted?

messages.content:
The Booting stage for banana crops typically occurs around 9 to 12 months after planting. It is essential to monitor the growth closely and submit the Booting stage when you observe the following signs:

1. **Development of the flower bud**: When the flower bud starts to emerge from the pseudostem.
2. **Timing**: Generally, this stage can be submitted when the crop is around 9-10 months old, depending on the variety and growing conditions.

Make sure to keep an eye on the crop's growth and environmental conditions to determine the right time for submission.
4.	If the temperature is high on the plot and Benoil is sprayed, does it cause scorching?
messages.standalone_question: Does spraying Benoil on a plot with high temperatures cause scorching?
messages.standalone_en: Does spraying Benoil on a plot with high temperatures cause scorching?

messages.content:
Yes, if the temperature is high on the plot and Benoil is sprayed, it can cause scorching. High temperatures can lead to rapid evaporation of the oil, which may result in burning or scorching of the leaves. 

To avoid this, it's best to spray Benoil during cooler parts of the day, such as early morning or late evening, when the temperature is lower.
5.	Can Galileo spraying be done on plots where the banana bunches have already appeared?
messages.standalone_question: Can Galileo spraying be done on plots where banana bunches have already appeared?
messages.standalone_en: Can Galileo spraying be done on plots where banana bunches have already appeared?

messages.content:
Yes, Galileo spraying can be done on plots where banana bunches have already appeared. However, it is essential to follow the recommended guidelines for application to avoid any potential harm to the fruit. 

Make sure to:

1. **Use the correct dosage**: Follow the manufacturer's instructions for the appropriate concentration.
2. **Timing**: Spray during cooler parts of the day to minimize stress on the plants.
3. **Avoid direct contact with the fruit**: Ensure that the spray does not directly hit the banana bunches to maintain fruit quality.

By taking these precautions, you can effectively use Galileo without negatively impacting the banana bunches.
6.	How much nitrogen should be given to bananas, from the beginning to harvest?
messages.standalone_question: How much nitrogen should be applied to banana plants from planting to harvest?
messages.standalone_en: How much nitrogen should be applied to banana plants from planting to harvest?

messages.content:
For banana crops, the recommended nitrogen application from the beginning to harvest is as follows:

1. **Establishment Phase (0-3 months)**: 100-150 kg/ha
2. **Early Growth Phase (3-6 months)**: 50-100 kg/ha
3. **Grand Growth Phase (6-9 months)**: 100-150 kg/ha
4. **Fruit Development Phase (9-12 months)**: 150-200 kg/ha
5. **Pre-Harvest**: 50-100 kg/ha

In total, the nitrogen requirement for banana crops can range from **400 to 600 kg/ha** throughout the growing season. Adjustments may be necessary based on soil fertility, crop variety, and environmental conditions.
7.	Can ammonium sulfate be given instead of urea?
messages.standalone_question: Can ammonium sulfate be used instead of urea for banana crops?
messages.standalone_en: Can ammonium sulfate be used instead of urea for banana crops?

messages.content:
Yes, ammonium sulfate can be given instead of urea for banana crops. Ammonium sulfate provides both nitrogen and sulfur, which are essential for plant growth. 

### Benefits of using ammonium sulfate:
1. **Nitrogen Source**: It supplies nitrogen in a form that is readily available to plants.
2. **Sulfur Content**: Sulfur is important for protein synthesis and overall plant health.
3. **Soil pH**: Ammonium sulfate can help lower soil pH, which may be beneficial in alkaline soils.

However, it's essential to monitor soil pH and nutrient levels to ensure that the application of ammonium sulfate meets the specific needs of your banana crop.
8.	Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering?
messages.standalone_question: Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering in banana crops?
messages.standalone_en: Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering in banana crops?

messages.content:
Yes, phosphoric acid can be used both before and after desuckering in banana crops. 

### Usage:
1. **Before Desuckering**: Applying phosphoric acid can help improve root development and overall plant health, preparing the plant for the desuckering process.
2. **After Desuckering**: It can aid in the recovery of the plant and support the growth of remaining suckers, enhancing nutrient uptake.

Ensure to follow the recommended application rates and timing for optimal results.
9.	In the first four months up to fruit setting, in which form should boron be given? Chelated or oxidized form?
messages.standalone_question: In the first four months up to fruit setting, should boron be given in chelated form or oxidized form?
messages.standalone_en: In the first four months up to fruit setting, should boron be given in chelated form or oxidized form?

messages.content:
In the first four months up to fruit setting, boron should be given in the **chelated form**. 

### Reasons:
1. **Better Absorption**: Chelated boron is more readily absorbed by the plant roots, ensuring that the plants receive the necessary nutrients effectively.
2. **Reduced Soil Fixation**: Chelated forms are less likely to be fixed in the soil, making them more available for plant uptake.

Using chelated boron will help support healthy growth and development during this critical stage of the banana crop.
10.	In the Fyllo app, there is no option for ammonium sulfate. What spraying should be done in such cases?
messages.standalone_question: If the Fyllo app does not have an option for ammonium sulfate, what alternative spraying options should be considered?
messages.standalone_en: If the Fyllo app does not have an option for ammonium sulfate, what alternative spraying options should be considered?

What is black splitting? Fungus or something? And how should it managed
messages.standalone_question: What is black splitting, and how should it be managed? Is it caused by a fungus or something else?
messages.standalone_en: What is black splitting, and how should it be managed? Is it caused by a fungus or something else?

messages.content:
**Black Splitting** is a physiological disorder that primarily affects banana fruits. It is characterized by the appearance of black streaks or splits on the surface of the fruit, which can lead to reduced marketability and quality.

### Causes:
- **Environmental Stress**: High humidity and rapid changes in temperature can contribute to this disorder.
- **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Lack of essential nutrients, particularly potassium and calcium, can increase susceptibility.
- **Water Stress**: Irregular watering or drought conditions can also lead to black splitting.

### Management:
1. **Water Management**: Ensure consistent and adequate irrigation to avoid water stress.
2. **Nutrient Management**: Apply balanced fertilizers, particularly those high in potassium and calcium, to support fruit development.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Maintain proper spacing and pruning to improve air circulation around the plants.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the plants for signs of stress and take corrective measures promptly.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of black splitting in banana crops.
What is physiological disorder
messages.standalone_question: What is a physiological disorder?
messages.standalone_en: What is a physiological disorder?

messages.content:
A **physiological disorder** refers to a condition in plants that arises from environmental factors, nutrient imbalances, or other non-pathogenic causes, rather than from infections by pathogens like fungi, bacteria, or viruses. These disorders can affect plant growth, development, and fruit quality.

### Common Causes of Physiological Disorders:
1. **Nutrient Deficiencies**: Lack of essential nutrients can lead to various disorders, such as blossom end rot in tomatoes due to calcium deficiency.
2. **Environmental Stress**: Factors like extreme temperatures, humidity, drought, or excessive rainfall can cause physiological disorders.
3. **Water Stress**: Irregular watering practices can lead to issues like fruit splitting or blossom drop.
4. **Soil Conditions**: Poor soil structure, pH imbalances, or salinity can also contribute to physiological disorders.

### Examples of Physiological Disorders:
- **Black Splitting** in bananas
- **Blossom End Rot** in tomatoes
- **Sunscald** in fruits
- **Fruit Drop** in various crops

Managing physiological disorders typically involves improving cultural practices, ensuring proper nutrient management, and monitoring environmental conditions to create a more favorable growing environment.
What is black pitting in banana
messages.standalone_question: What is black pitting in bananas?
messages.standalone_en: What is black pitting in bananas?

messages.content:
**Black Pitting** in bananas is a physiological disorder characterized by the formation of small, dark, sunken spots or pits on the surface of the fruit. This condition can affect the quality and marketability of the bananas.

### Causes:
1. **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Insufficient levels of potassium, calcium, or magnesium can contribute to the development of black pitting.
2. **Environmental Stress**: High humidity, temperature fluctuations, and water stress can exacerbate the condition.
3. **Mechanical Damage**: Physical injuries during handling or transportation can lead to pitting.

### Management:
1. **Nutrient Management**: Ensure adequate fertilization, particularly with potassium and calcium, to support healthy fruit development.
2. **Water Management**: Maintain consistent irrigation practices to avoid water stress.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Handle bananas carefully during harvesting and transportation to minimize mechanical damage.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the crop for signs of stress or nutrient deficiencies and take corrective actions as needed.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of black pitting in banana crops.
Pitting disease in banana
messages.standalone_question: What is pitting disease in bananas?
messages.standalone_en: What is pitting disease in bananas?

messages.content:
**Pitting disease** in bananas is a physiological disorder characterized by the formation of small, sunken pits or depressions on the surface of the fruit. This condition can affect the quality and marketability of bananas.

### Causes:
1. **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Insufficient levels of potassium, calcium, or magnesium can lead to pitting.
2. **Environmental Stress**: High humidity, temperature fluctuations, and inconsistent watering can exacerbate the disorder.
3. **Mechanical Damage**: Physical injuries during handling or transportation can also contribute to the development of pits.

### Management:
1. **Nutrient Management**: Ensure adequate fertilization, particularly with potassium and calcium, to support healthy fruit development.
2. **Water Management**: Maintain consistent irrigation practices to avoid water stress.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Handle bananas carefully during harvesting and transportation to minimize mechanical damage.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the crop for signs of stress or nutrient deficiencies and take corrective actions as needed.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of pitting disease in banana crops.

होय, युरिया पेक्षा अमोनियम सल्फेट दिले तरी चालेल, विशेषतः केळीच्या पिकांसाठी. अमोनियम सल्फेटमध्ये नायट्रोजन आणि सल्फर दोन्ही असतात, जे पिकांच्या वाढीसाठी आवश्यक आहेत. 

अमोनियम सल्फेटचा वापर केल्याने:

1. **नायट्रोजनची उपलब्धता**: पिकांना आवश्यक नायट्रोजन मिळतो, ज्यामुळे पिकांची वाढ सुधारते.
2. **सल्फरची उपलब्धता**: सल्फर मुळांच्या विकासासाठी आणि फळांच्या गुणवत्तेसाठी महत्त्वाचा आहे.

तथापि, अमोनियम सल्फेटचा वापर करताना, मातीच्या pH स्तराचा विचार करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे, कारण यामुळे मातीची अम्लता वाढू शकते. त्यामुळे योग्य प्रमाणात आणि वेळेत वापर करणे आवश्यक आहे.
नायट्रोजन चे प्रमाण केळी किती दिले पाहिजे, सुरुवातीपासून ते हार्वेस्टिंग पर्यंत?

केळीच्या पिकांसाठी नायट्रोजनचे प्रमाण सुरुवातीपासून हार्वेस्टिंगपर्यंत खालीलप्रमाणे असावे:

1. **सुरुवात (सिंचन व स्थापन)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
2. **प्रारंभिक वाढ (1-3 महिने)**: 50-100 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
3. **मध्यम वाढ (3-6 महिने)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
4. **ग्रँड ग्रोथ फेज (6-9 महिने)**: 150-200 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
5. **फळ विकास (9-12 महिने)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
6. **हार्वेस्टिंगपूर्वी**: 50-100 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर

एकूण, केळीच्या पिकासाठी 400-600 किग्रॅ नायट्रोजन प्रति हेक्टेअर आवश्यक असते. हे प्रमाण पिकाच्या अवस्थेनुसार आणि मातीच्या पोषणाच्या गरजेनुसार समायोजित करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे. 

तुमच्या मातीच्या विशिष्ट गरजेनुसार आणि पिकाच्या अवस्थेनुसार योग्य प्रमाणात नायट्रोजन देणे आवश्यक आहे.

होय, केळीच्या पिकांवर गॅलिलिओ फवारणी करणे उपयुक्त ठरू शकते, विशेषतः जेव्हा पिकांमध्ये घड आलेले असतात. गॅलिलिओ एक प्रकारचे फोलिअर खत आहे, जे पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी आणि वाढीसाठी आवश्यक पोषण प्रदान करते.

फवारणी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **सही प्रमाण**: गॅलिलिओचे प्रमाण योग्य प्रमाणात वापरा, जेणेकरून पिकांना आवश्यक पोषण मिळेल.
2. **फवारणीची वेळ**: सकाळी किंवा संध्याकाळी फवारणी करणे अधिक प्रभावी असते, कारण त्या वेळी तापमान कमी असते.
3. **आवश्यकता**: पिकांच्या विशेष गरजेनुसार फवारणी करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

तुमच्या पिकाच्या स्थितीनुसार आणि गरजेनुसार गॅलिलिओ फवारणी करणे उपयुक्त ठरू शकते.

होय, जर प्लॉटवर तापमान जास्त असेल आणि तुम्ही बेन ऑइलची फवारणी केली, तर त्याने स्कॉर्चिंग होण्याची शक्यता असते. उच्च तापमानामुळे पानांवर फवारलेले तेल वाष्पीकरण होऊ शकते, ज्यामुळे पानांवर जळणारे किंवा स्कॉर्चिंगचे लक्षणे दिसू शकतात.

फवारणी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **तापमान**: उच्च तापमानात फवारणी टाळा, विशेषतः दुपारी.
2. **फवारणीची वेळ**: सकाळी किंवा संध्याकाळी फवारणी करणे अधिक सुरक्षित असते.
3. **पाण्याचा वापर**: बेन ऑइलसह पाण्याचे प्रमाण योग्य प्रमाणात ठेवा, जेणेकरून पानांवर जास्त ताण येणार नाही.

तुमच्या पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी योग्य काळजी घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

messages.content:
ब्लॅक स्प्लीटींग (Black Splitting) हे एक बुरशीजन्य रोग आहे, जो मुख्यतः केळीच्या पिकांमध्ये आढळतो. हा रोग फळांच्या बाह्य आवरणावर काळ्या धब्बे किंवा फाटे निर्माण करतो, ज्यामुळे फळांची गुणवत्ता कमी होते आणि बाजारात विक्रीसाठी अयोग्य ठरतात.

### व्यवस्थापन:

1. **साफसफाई**: शेतातील मृत किंवा संक्रमित पानं आणि फळं काढून टाका, जेणेकरून रोगाचा प्रसार थांबेल.

2. **सुरक्षित फवारणी**: बुरशीजन्य रोगांवर नियंत्रण ठेवण्यासाठी योग्य बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर करा. फवारणी करताना तापमान आणि आर्द्रता यांचा विचार करा.

3. **पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन**: पाण्याची योग्य मात्रा आणि वेळेवर सिंचन करा. ओलसर वातावरणामुळे रोगाचा प्रसार होऊ शकतो.

4. **पिकांची निवड**: रोग प्रतिकारक केळीच्या जातींचा वापर करा, जेणेकरून रोगाचा प्रभाव कमी होईल.

5. **पोषण व्यवस्थापन**: पिकांना आवश्यक पोषण देणे महत्त्वाचे आहे, जेणेकरून ते रोगांवर अधिक प्रतिकार करू शकतील.

6. **संपूर्ण निरीक्षण**: पिकांची नियमितपणे तपासणी करा, जेणेकरून रोगाची लक्षणे लवकर ओळखता येतील.

या उपाययोजनांचा अवलंब करून तुम्ही ब्लॅक स्प्लीटींगच्या प्रभावी व्यवस्थापनात मदत करू शकता.

messages.content:
केळीच्या पिकात **बूटिंग स्टेज** साधारणतः फळांच्या विकासाच्या प्रक्रियेत येते, जेव्हा फळांचे बूट तयार होतात. या स्टेजमध्ये योग्य व्यवस्थापन करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

### बूटिंग स्टेज कधी सबमिट करायची:
बूटिंग स्टेज साधारणतः केळीच्या पिकाच्या **ग्रँड ग्रोथ फेज** नंतर येते. तुम्ही बूटिंग स्टेजची तयारी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **तपशीलवार निरीक्षण**: पिकांच्या वाढीवर लक्ष ठेवा आणि बूटिंग स्टेजच्या सुरुवातीच्या लक्षणांची ओळख करा.
2. **सही वेळ**: बूटिंग स्टेज साधारणतः 9-12 महिन्यांच्या दरम्यान येते, त्यामुळे तुम्ही या कालावधीत व्यवस्थापन करणे सुरू करा.

### बूटिंग स्टेजचे व्यवस्थापन:
1. **पोषण व्यवस्थापन**: 
   - फॉस्फरस आणि पोटॅशियमचे प्रमाण वाढवा, जे फळांच्या विकासासाठी आवश्यक आहे.
   - योग्य खतांचा वापर करा, जसे की DAP किंवा MOP.

2. **पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन**: 
   - सिंचनाची योग्य मात्रा ठेवा, कारण या स्टेजमध्ये पाण्याची गरज वाढते.
   - ओलसर वातावरण टाळा, जेणेकरून बुरशीजन्य रोगांचा प्रसार होणार नाही.

3. **रोग नियंत्रण**: 
   - बुरशीजन्य रोगांवर नियंत्रण ठेवण्यासाठी योग्य बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर करा.
   - पिकांची नियमितपणे तपासणी करा.

4. **फळांची काळजी**: 
   - फळांच्या बूटिंगच्या वेळी पिकांची काळजी घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे, त्यामुळे फळांची गुणवत्ता सुधारते.

5. **सुरक्षितता**: 
   - पिकांच्या आजारांपासून संरक्षण करण्यासाठी योग्य उपाययोजना करा.

या सर्व गोष्टींचा विचार करून तुम्ही बूटिंग स्टेजमध्ये केळीच्या पिकाचे व्यवस्थापन प्रभावीपणे करू शकता.

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.

get_optimal_soil_moistures  
Retrieves the optimal soil moisture values in kPa or percentage above which to irrigate for all plots. 0 kPa means wet, 200 kPa means dry soil. In percentage: 0% means dry, 100% means wet. In percentage values, irrigate when below the optimum range.

get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".
faq:
Q: In the latest irrigation , sensor didn't drop to 0.
A: 0 to 5 Kpa means soil is fully wet. It need not drop to 0 every time. Moisture less than 5 also means wet conditions. So, need not worry. Also ask to wait for 12 hours after irrigation.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows wet values?
A: Verify the irrigation frequency, check the installation point, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

0-5 kPa चा अर्थ आहे की माती ओलसर आहे, त्यामुळे अतिरिक्त फर्टिगेशन केल्याने पिकांना नुकसान होऊ शकते. ओलसर मातीमध्ये फर्टिलायझरची आवश्यकता कमी असते, त्यामुळे योग्य काळजी घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

2.	When should the Booting stage be submitted?
messages.standalone_question: When should the booting stage be submitted?
messages.standalone_en: When should the booting stage be submitted?

messages.content:
The Booting stage for banana crops typically occurs around 9 to 12 months after planting. It is essential to monitor the growth closely and submit the Booting stage when you observe the following signs:

1. **Development of the flower bud**: When the flower bud starts to emerge from the pseudostem.
2. **Timing**: Generally, this stage can be submitted when the crop is around 9-10 months old, depending on the variety and growing conditions.

Make sure to keep an eye on the crop's growth and environmental conditions to determine the right time for submission.
4.	If the temperature is high on the plot and Benoil is sprayed, does it cause scorching?
messages.standalone_question: Does spraying Benoil on a plot with high temperatures cause scorching?
messages.standalone_en: Does spraying Benoil on a plot with high temperatures cause scorching?

messages.content:
Yes, if the temperature is high on the plot and Benoil is sprayed, it can cause scorching. High temperatures can lead to rapid evaporation of the oil, which may result in burning or scorching of the leaves. 

To avoid this, it's best to spray Benoil during cooler parts of the day, such as early morning or late evening, when the temperature is lower.
5.	Can Galileo spraying be done on plots where the banana bunches have already appeared?
messages.standalone_question: Can Galileo spraying be applied to plots where banana bunches have already formed?
messages.standalone_en: Can Galileo spraying be applied to plots where banana bunches have already formed?

messages.content:
Yes, Galileo spraying can be done on plots where banana bunches have already appeared. However, it is essential to follow the recommended guidelines for application to avoid any potential harm to the fruit. 

Make sure to:

1. **Use the correct dosage**: Follow the manufacturer's instructions for the appropriate concentration.
2. **Timing**: Spray during cooler parts of the day to minimize stress on the plants.
3. **Avoid direct contact with the fruit**: Ensure that the spray does not directly hit the banana bunches to maintain fruit quality.

By taking these precautions, you can effectively use Galileo without negatively impacting the banana bunches.
6.	How much nitrogen should be given to bananas, from the beginning to harvest?
messages.standalone_question: How much nitrogen should be applied to banana plants from planting to harvest?
messages.standalone_en: How much nitrogen should be applied to banana plants from planting to harvest?

messages.content:
For banana crops, the recommended nitrogen application from the beginning to harvest is as follows:

1. **Establishment Phase (0-3 months)**: 100-150 kg/ha
2. **Early Growth Phase (3-6 months)**: 50-100 kg/ha
3. **Grand Growth Phase (6-9 months)**: 100-150 kg/ha
4. **Fruit Development Phase (9-12 months)**: 150-200 kg/ha
5. **Pre-Harvest**: 50-100 kg/ha

In total, the nitrogen requirement for banana crops can range from **400 to 600 kg/ha** throughout the growing season. Adjustments may be necessary based on soil fertility, crop variety, and environmental conditions.
7.	Can ammonium sulfate be given instead of urea?
messages.standalone_question: Can ammonium sulfate be used instead of urea for banana crops?
messages.standalone_en: Can ammonium sulfate be used instead of urea for banana crops?

messages.content:
Yes, ammonium sulfate can be given instead of urea for banana crops. Ammonium sulfate provides both nitrogen and sulfur, which are essential for plant growth. 

### Benefits of using ammonium sulfate:
1. **Nitrogen Source**: It supplies nitrogen in a form that is readily available to plants.
2. **Sulfur Content**: Sulfur is important for protein synthesis and overall plant health.
3. **Soil pH**: Ammonium sulfate can help lower soil pH, which may be beneficial in alkaline soils.

However, it's essential to monitor soil pH and nutrient levels to ensure that the application of ammonium sulfate meets the specific needs of your banana crop.
8.	Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering?
messages.standalone_question: Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering in banana crops?
messages.standalone_en: Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering in banana crops?

messages.content:
Yes, phosphoric acid can be used both before and after desuckering in banana crops. 

### Usage:
1. **Before Desuckering**: Applying phosphoric acid can help improve root development and overall plant health, preparing the plant for the desuckering process.
2. **After Desuckering**: It can aid in the recovery of the plant and support the growth of remaining suckers, enhancing nutrient uptake.

Ensure to follow the recommended application rates and timing for optimal results.
9.	In the first four months up to fruit setting, in which form should boron be given? Chelated or oxidized form?
messages.standalone_question: In the first four months up to fruit setting, should boron be given in chelated form or oxidized form?
messages.standalone_en: In the first four months up to fruit setting, should boron be given in chelated form or oxidized form?

messages.content:
In the first four months up to fruit setting, boron should be given in the **chelated form**. 

### Reasons:
1. **Better Absorption**: Chelated boron is more readily absorbed by the plant roots, ensuring that the plants receive the necessary nutrients effectively.
2. **Reduced Soil Fixation**: Chelated forms are less likely to be fixed in the soil, making them more available for plant uptake.

Using chelated boron will help support healthy growth and development during this critical stage of the banana crop.

messages.standalone_question: If the Fyllo app does not have an option for ammonium sulfate, what alternative spraying options should be considered?

What is black splitting? Fungus or something? And how should it managed
messages.standalone_question: What is black splitting, and how should it be managed? Is it caused by a fungus or something else?
messages.standalone_en: What is black splitting, and how should it be managed? Is it caused by a fungus or something else?

messages.content:
**Black Splitting** is a physiological disorder that primarily affects banana fruits. It is characterized by the appearance of black streaks or splits on the surface of the fruit, which can lead to reduced marketability and quality.

### Causes:
- **Environmental Stress**: High humidity and rapid changes in temperature can contribute to this disorder.
- **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Lack of essential nutrients, particularly potassium and calcium, can increase susceptibility.
- **Water Stress**: Irregular watering or drought conditions can also lead to black splitting.

### Management:
1. **Water Management**: Ensure consistent and adequate irrigation to avoid water stress.
2. **Nutrient Management**: Apply balanced fertilizers, particularly those high in potassium and calcium, to support fruit development.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Maintain proper spacing and pruning to improve air circulation around the plants.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the plants for signs of stress and take corrective measures promptly.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of black splitting in banana crops.
What is physiological disorder
messages.standalone_question: What is a physiological disorder?
messages.standalone_en: What is a physiological disorder?

messages.content:
A **physiological disorder** refers to a condition in plants that arises from environmental factors, nutrient imbalances, or other non-pathogenic causes, rather than from infections by pathogens like fungi, bacteria, or viruses. These disorders can affect plant growth, development, and fruit quality.

### Common Causes of Physiological Disorders:
1. **Nutrient Deficiencies**: Lack of essential nutrients can lead to various disorders, such as blossom end rot in tomatoes due to calcium deficiency.
2. **Environmental Stress**: Factors like extreme temperatures, humidity, drought, or excessive rainfall can cause physiological disorders.
3. **Water Stress**: Irregular watering practices can lead to issues like fruit splitting or blossom drop.
4. **Soil Conditions**: Poor soil structure, pH imbalances, or salinity can also contribute to physiological disorders.

### Examples of Physiological Disorders:
- **Black Splitting** in bananas
- **Blossom End Rot** in tomatoes
- **Sunscald** in fruits
- **Fruit Drop** in various crops

Managing physiological disorders typically involves improving cultural practices, ensuring proper nutrient management, and monitoring environmental conditions to create a more favorable growing environment.
What is black pitting in banana
messages.standalone_question: What is black pitting in bananas?
messages.standalone_en: What is black pitting in bananas?

messages.content:
**Black Pitting** in bananas is a physiological disorder characterized by the formation of small, dark, sunken spots or pits on the surface of the fruit. This condition can affect the quality and marketability of the bananas.

### Causes:
1. **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Insufficient levels of potassium, calcium, or magnesium can contribute to the development of black pitting.
2. **Environmental Stress**: High humidity, temperature fluctuations, and water stress can exacerbate the condition.
3. **Mechanical Damage**: Physical injuries during handling or transportation can lead to pitting.

### Management:
1. **Nutrient Management**: Ensure adequate fertilization, particularly with potassium and calcium, to support healthy fruit development.
2. **Water Management**: Maintain consistent irrigation practices to avoid water stress.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Handle bananas carefully during harvesting and transportation to minimize mechanical damage.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the crop for signs of stress or nutrient deficiencies and take corrective actions as needed.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of black pitting in banana crops.
Pitting disease in banana
messages.standalone_question: What is pitting disease in bananas, and how can it be managed?
messages.standalone_en: What is pitting disease in bananas, and how can it be managed?

messages.content:
**Pitting disease** in bananas is a physiological disorder characterized by the formation of small, sunken pits or depressions on the surface of the fruit. This condition can affect the quality and marketability of bananas.

### Causes:
1. **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Insufficient levels of potassium, calcium, or magnesium can lead to pitting.
2. **Environmental Stress**: High humidity, temperature fluctuations, and inconsistent watering can exacerbate the disorder.
3. **Mechanical Damage**: Physical injuries during handling or transportation can also contribute to the development of pits.

### Management:
1. **Nutrient Management**: Ensure adequate fertilization, particularly with potassium and calcium, to support healthy fruit development.
2. **Water Management**: Maintain consistent irrigation practices to avoid water stress.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Handle bananas carefully during harvesting and transportation to minimize mechanical damage.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the crop for signs of stress or nutrient deficiencies and take corrective actions as needed.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of pitting disease in banana crops.

केळीच्या पिकांसाठी नायट्रोजनचे प्रमाण सुरुवातीपासून हार्वेस्टिंगपर्यंत खालीलप्रमाणे असावे:

1. **सुरुवात (सिंचन व स्थापन)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
2. **प्रारंभिक वाढ (1-3 महिने)**: 50-100 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
3. **मध्यम वाढ (3-6 महिने)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
4. **ग्रँड ग्रोथ फेज (6-9 महिने)**: 150-200 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
5. **फळ विकास (9-12 महिने)**: 100-150 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर
6. **हार्वेस्टिंगपूर्वी**: 50-100 किग्रॅ/हेक्टेअर

messages.content:
होय, केळीच्या पिकांवर गॅलिलिओ फवारणी करणे उपयुक्त ठरू शकते, विशेषतः जेव्हा पिकांमध्ये घड आलेले असतात. गॅलिलिओ एक प्रकारचे फोलिअर खत आहे, जे पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी आणि वाढीसाठी आवश्यक पोषण प्रदान करते.

फवारणी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **सही प्रमाण**: गॅलिलिओचे प्रमाण योग्य प्रमाणात वापरा, जेणेकरून पिकांना आवश्यक पोषण मिळेल.
2. **फवारणीची वेळ**: सकाळी किंवा संध्याकाळी फवारणी करणे अधिक प्रभावी असते, कारण त्या वेळी तापमान कमी असते.
3. **आवश्यकता**: पिकांच्या विशेष गरजेनुसार फवारणी करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

तुमच्या पिकाच्या स्थितीनुसार आणि गरजेनुसार गॅलिलिओ फवारणी करणे उपयुक्त ठरू शकते.

होय, जर प्लॉटवर तापमान जास्त असेल आणि तुम्ही बेन ऑइलची फवारणी केली, तर त्याने स्कॉर्चिंग होण्याची शक्यता असते. उच्च तापमानामुळे पानांवर फवारलेले तेल वाष्पीकरण होऊ शकते, ज्यामुळे पानांवर जळणारे किंवा स्कॉर्चिंगचे लक्षणे दिसू शकतात.

फवारणी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **तापमान**: उच्च तापमानात फवारणी टाळा, विशेषतः दुपारी.
2. **फवारणीची वेळ**: सकाळी किंवा संध्याकाळी फवारणी करणे अधिक सुरक्षित असते.
3. **पाण्याचा वापर**: बेन ऑइलसह पाण्याचे प्रमाण योग्य प्रमाणात ठेवा, जेणेकरून पानांवर जास्त ताण येणार नाही.

तुमच्या पिकांच्या आरोग्यासाठी योग्य काळजी घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

messages.content:
ब्लॅक स्प्लीटींग (Black Splitting) हे एक बुरशीजन्य रोग आहे, जो मुख्यतः केळीच्या पिकांमध्ये आढळतो. हा रोग फळांच्या बाह्य आवरणावर काळ्या धब्बे किंवा फाटे निर्माण करतो, ज्यामुळे फळांची गुणवत्ता कमी होते आणि बाजारात विक्रीसाठी अयोग्य ठरतात.

### व्यवस्थापन:

1. **साफसफाई**: शेतातील मृत किंवा संक्रमित पानं आणि फळं काढून टाका, जेणेकरून रोगाचा प्रसार थांबेल.

2. **सुरक्षित फवारणी**: बुरशीजन्य रोगांवर नियंत्रण ठेवण्यासाठी योग्य बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर करा. फवारणी करताना तापमान आणि आर्द्रता यांचा विचार करा.

3. **पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन**: पाण्याची योग्य मात्रा आणि वेळेवर सिंचन करा. ओलसर वातावरणामुळे रोगाचा प्रसार होऊ शकतो.

4. **पिकांची निवड**: रोग प्रतिकारक केळीच्या जातींचा वापर करा, जेणेकरून रोगाचा प्रभाव कमी होईल.

5. **पोषण व्यवस्थापन**: पिकांना आवश्यक पोषण देणे महत्त्वाचे आहे, जेणेकरून ते रोगांवर अधिक प्रतिकार करू शकतील.

6. **संपूर्ण निरीक्षण**: पिकांची नियमितपणे तपासणी करा, जेणेकरून रोगाची लक्षणे लवकर ओळखता येतील.

या उपाययोजनांचा अवलंब करून तुम्ही ब्लॅक स्प्लीटींगच्या प्रभावी व्यवस्थापनात मदत करू शकता.

messages.content:
केळीच्या पिकात **बूटिंग स्टेज** साधारणतः फळांच्या विकासाच्या प्रक्रियेत येते, जेव्हा फळांचे बूट तयार होतात. या स्टेजमध्ये योग्य व्यवस्थापन करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

### बूटिंग स्टेज कधी सबमिट करायची:
बूटिंग स्टेज साधारणतः केळीच्या पिकाच्या **ग्रँड ग्रोथ फेज** नंतर येते. तुम्ही बूटिंग स्टेजची तयारी करताना खालील गोष्टी लक्षात ठेवा:

1. **तपशीलवार निरीक्षण**: पिकांच्या वाढीवर लक्ष ठेवा आणि बूटिंग स्टेजच्या सुरुवातीच्या लक्षणांची ओळख करा.
2. **सही वेळ**: बूटिंग स्टेज साधारणतः 9-12 महिन्यांच्या दरम्यान येते, त्यामुळे तुम्ही या कालावधीत व्यवस्थापन करणे सुरू करा.

### बूटिंग स्टेजचे व्यवस्थापन:
1. **पोषण व्यवस्थापन**: 
   - फॉस्फरस आणि पोटॅशियमचे प्रमाण वाढवा, जे फळांच्या विकासासाठी आवश्यक आहे.
   - योग्य खतांचा वापर करा, जसे की DAP किंवा MOP.

2. **पाण्याचे व्यवस्थापन**: 
   - सिंचनाची योग्य मात्रा ठेवा, कारण या स्टेजमध्ये पाण्याची गरज वाढते.
   - ओलसर वातावरण टाळा, जेणेकरून बुरशीजन्य रोगांचा प्रसार होणार नाही.

3. **रोग नियंत्रण**: 
   - बुरशीजन्य रोगांवर नियंत्रण ठेवण्यासाठी योग्य बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर करा.
   - पिकांची नियमितपणे तपासणी करा.

4. **फळांची काळजी**: 
   - फळांच्या बूटिंगच्या वेळी पिकांची काळजी घेणे महत्त्वाचे आहे, त्यामुळे फळांची गुणवत्ता सुधारते.

5. **सुरक्षितता**: 
   - पिकांच्या आजारांपासून संरक्षण करण्यासाठी योग्य उपाययोजना करा.

या सर्व गोष्टींचा विचार करून तुम्ही बूटिंग स्टेजमध्ये केळीच्या पिकाचे व्यवस्थापन प्रभावीपणे करू शकता.

tools:
should_i_give_water  
Checks the current and optimal soil moisture values and decides whether the farmer should give water to the plot now or today.

get_optimal_soil_moistures  
Retrieves the optimal soil moisture values in kPa or percentage above which to irrigate for all plots. 0 kPa means wet, 200 kPa means dry soil. In percentage: 0% means dry, 100% means wet. In percentage values, irrigate when below the optimum range.

get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".
faq:
Q: In the latest irrigation , sensor didn't drop to 0.
A: 0 to 5 Kpa means soil is fully wet. It need not drop to 0 every time. Moisture less than 5 also means wet conditions. So, need not worry. Also ask to wait for 12 hours after irrigation.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor always shows wet values?
A: Verify the irrigation frequency, check the installation point, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: What should I do if the soil moisture sensor values fluctuate?
A: Ensure the sensor is installed properly in the soil, check for air bubbles, and contact Fyllo representative if the issue persists.

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

2.	When should the Booting stage be submitted?
messages.standalone_question: When should the booting stage be submitted?
messages.standalone_en: When should the booting stage be submitted?

messages.content:
The Booting stage for banana crops typically occurs around 9 to 12 months after planting. It is essential to monitor the growth closely and submit the Booting stage when you observe the following signs:

1. **Development of the flower bud**: When the flower bud starts to emerge from the pseudostem.
2. **Timing**: Generally, this stage can be submitted when the crop is around 9-10 months old, depending on the variety and growing conditions.

Make sure to keep an eye on the crop's growth and environmental conditions to determine the right time for submission.
4.	If the temperature is high on the plot and Benoil is sprayed, does it cause scorching?
messages.standalone_question: Does spraying Benoil on a plot with high temperatures cause scorching?
messages.standalone_en: Does spraying Benoil on a plot with high temperatures cause scorching?

messages.content:
Yes, if the temperature is high on the plot and Benoil is sprayed, it can cause scorching. High temperatures can lead to rapid evaporation of the oil, which may result in burning or scorching of the leaves. 

To avoid this, it's best to spray Benoil during cooler parts of the day, such as early morning or late evening, when the temperature is lower.
5.	Can Galileo spraying be done on plots where the banana bunches have already appeared?
messages.standalone_question: Can Galileo spraying be applied to plots where banana bunches have already formed?
messages.standalone_en: Can Galileo spraying be applied to plots where banana bunches have already formed?

messages.content:
Yes, Galileo spraying can be done on plots where banana bunches have already appeared. However, it is essential to follow the recommended guidelines for application to avoid any potential harm to the fruit. 

Make sure to:

1. **Use the correct dosage**: Follow the manufacturer's instructions for the appropriate concentration.
2. **Timing**: Spray during cooler parts of the day to minimize stress on the plants.
3. **Avoid direct contact with the fruit**: Ensure that the spray does not directly hit the banana bunches to maintain fruit quality.

By taking these precautions, you can effectively use Galileo without negatively impacting the banana bunches.
6.	How much nitrogen should be given to bananas, from the beginning to harvest?
messages.standalone_question: How much nitrogen should be applied to banana plants from planting to harvest?
messages.standalone_en: How much nitrogen should be applied to banana plants from planting to harvest?

messages.content:
For banana crops, the recommended nitrogen application from the beginning to harvest is as follows:

1. **Establishment Phase (0-3 months)**: 100-150 kg/ha
2. **Early Growth Phase (3-6 months)**: 50-100 kg/ha
3. **Grand Growth Phase (6-9 months)**: 100-150 kg/ha
4. **Fruit Development Phase (9-12 months)**: 150-200 kg/ha
5. **Pre-Harvest**: 50-100 kg/ha

In total, the nitrogen requirement for banana crops can range from **400 to 600 kg/ha** throughout the growing season. Adjustments may be necessary based on soil fertility, crop variety, and environmental conditions.
7.	Can ammonium sulfate be given instead of urea?
messages.standalone_question: Can ammonium sulfate be used instead of urea for banana crops?
messages.standalone_en: Can ammonium sulfate be used instead of urea for banana crops?

messages.content:
Yes, ammonium sulfate can be given instead of urea for banana crops. Ammonium sulfate provides both nitrogen and sulfur, which are essential for plant growth. 

### Benefits of using ammonium sulfate:
1. **Nitrogen Source**: It supplies nitrogen in a form that is readily available to plants.
2. **Sulfur Content**: Sulfur is important for protein synthesis and overall plant health.
3. **Soil pH**: Ammonium sulfate can help lower soil pH, which may be beneficial in alkaline soils.

However, it's essential to monitor soil pH and nutrient levels to ensure that the application of ammonium sulfate meets the specific needs of your banana crop.
8.	Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering?
messages.standalone_question: Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering in banana crops?
messages.standalone_en: Can phosphoric acid be used before and after desuckering in banana crops?

messages.content:
Yes, phosphoric acid can be used both before and after desuckering in banana crops. 

### Usage:
1. **Before Desuckering**: Applying phosphoric acid can help improve root development and overall plant health, preparing the plant for the desuckering process.
2. **After Desuckering**: It can aid in the recovery of the plant and support the growth of remaining suckers, enhancing nutrient uptake.

Ensure to follow the recommended application rates and timing for optimal results.
9.	In the first four months up to fruit setting, in which form should boron be given? Chelated or oxidized form?
messages.standalone_question: In the first four months up to fruit setting, should boron be given in chelated form or oxidized form?
messages.standalone_en: In the first four months up to fruit setting, should boron be given in chelated form or oxidized form?

messages.content:
In the first four months up to fruit setting, boron should be given in the **chelated form**. 

### Reasons:
1. **Better Absorption**: Chelated boron is more readily absorbed by the plant roots, ensuring that the plants receive the necessary nutrients effectively.
2. **Reduced Soil Fixation**: Chelated forms are less likely to be fixed in the soil, making them more available for plant uptake.

Using chelated boron will help support healthy growth and development during this critical stage of the banana crop.
10.	In the Fyllo app, there is no option for ammonium sulfate. What spraying should be done in such cases?
messages.standalone_question: If the Fyllo app does not have an option for ammonium sulfate, what alternative spraying options should be considered?
messages.standalone_en: If the Fyllo app does not have an option for ammonium sulfate, what alternative spraying options should be considered?

Q: Does Fyllo provide a fertigation schedule?

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?

Q: How can I trust that Fyllo's fertigation schedule is accurate?

Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

messages.content:
If the Fyllo app does not show an option for ammonium sulfate, you can consider using alternative nitrogen sources such as:

1. **Urea**: A common nitrogen fertilizer that can be used effectively.
2. **Calcium Nitrate**: Provides both nitrogen and calcium, beneficial for plant health.
3. **Fertigation**: If you have access to fertigation, you can use liquid nitrogen fertilizers.

Always ensure to follow the recommended application rates and timings based on your crop's specific needs.
What is black splitting? Fungus or something? And how should it managed
messages.standalone_question: What is black splitting, and how should it be managed? Is it caused by a fungus or something else?
messages.standalone_en: What is black splitting, and how should it be managed? Is it caused by a fungus or something else?

messages.content:
**Black Splitting** is a physiological disorder that primarily affects banana fruits. It is characterized by the appearance of black streaks or splits on the surface of the fruit, which can lead to reduced marketability and quality.

### Causes:
- **Environmental Stress**: High humidity and rapid changes in temperature can contribute to this disorder.
- **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Lack of essential nutrients, particularly potassium and calcium, can increase susceptibility.
- **Water Stress**: Irregular watering or drought conditions can also lead to black splitting.

### Management:
1. **Water Management**: Ensure consistent and adequate irrigation to avoid water stress.
2. **Nutrient Management**: Apply balanced fertilizers, particularly those high in potassium and calcium, to support fruit development.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Maintain proper spacing and pruning to improve air circulation around the plants.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the plants for signs of stress and take corrective measures promptly.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of black splitting in banana crops.
What is physiological disorder
messages.standalone_question: What is a physiological disorder in plants?
messages.standalone_en: What is a physiological disorder in plants?

messages.content:
A **physiological disorder** refers to a condition in plants that arises from environmental factors, nutrient imbalances, or other non-pathogenic causes, rather than from infections by pathogens like fungi, bacteria, or viruses. These disorders can affect plant growth, development, and fruit quality.

### Common Causes of Physiological Disorders:
1. **Nutrient Deficiencies**: Lack of essential nutrients can lead to various disorders, such as blossom end rot in tomatoes due to calcium deficiency.
2. **Environmental Stress**: Factors like extreme temperatures, humidity, drought, or excessive rainfall can cause physiological disorders.
3. **Water Stress**: Irregular watering practices can lead to issues like fruit splitting or blossom drop.
4. **Soil Conditions**: Poor soil structure, pH imbalances, or salinity can also contribute to physiological disorders.

### Examples of Physiological Disorders:
- **Black Splitting** in bananas
- **Blossom End Rot** in tomatoes
- **Sunscald** in fruits
- **Fruit Drop** in various crops

Managing physiological disorders typically involves improving cultural practices, ensuring proper nutrient management, and monitoring environmental conditions to create a more favorable growing environment.
What is black pitting in banana
messages.standalone_question: What is black pitting in bananas?
messages.standalone_en: What is black pitting in bananas?

messages.content:
**Black Pitting** in bananas is a physiological disorder characterized by the formation of small, dark, sunken spots or pits on the surface of the fruit. This condition can affect the quality and marketability of the bananas.

### Causes:
1. **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Insufficient levels of potassium, calcium, or magnesium can contribute to the development of black pitting.
2. **Environmental Stress**: High humidity, temperature fluctuations, and water stress can exacerbate the condition.
3. **Mechanical Damage**: Physical injuries during handling or transportation can lead to pitting.

### Management:
1. **Nutrient Management**: Ensure adequate fertilization, particularly with potassium and calcium, to support healthy fruit development.
2. **Water Management**: Maintain consistent irrigation practices to avoid water stress.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Handle bananas carefully during harvesting and transportation to minimize mechanical damage.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the crop for signs of stress or nutrient deficiencies and take corrective actions as needed.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of black pitting in banana crops.
Pitting disease in banana
messages.standalone_question: What is pitting disease in bananas, and how can it be managed?
messages.standalone_en: What is pitting disease in bananas, and how can it be managed?

messages.content:
**Pitting disease** in bananas is a physiological disorder characterized by the formation of small, sunken pits or depressions on the surface of the fruit. This condition can affect the quality and marketability of bananas.

### Causes:
1. **Nutritional Deficiencies**: Insufficient levels of potassium, calcium, or magnesium can lead to pitting.
2. **Environmental Stress**: High humidity, temperature fluctuations, and inconsistent watering can exacerbate the disorder.
3. **Mechanical Damage**: Physical injuries during handling or transportation can also contribute to the development of pits.

### Management:
1. **Nutrient Management**: Ensure adequate fertilization, particularly with potassium and calcium, to support healthy fruit development.
2. **Water Management**: Maintain consistent irrigation practices to avoid water stress.
3. **Cultural Practices**: Handle bananas carefully during harvesting and transportation to minimize mechanical damage.
4. **Monitoring**: Regularly inspect the crop for signs of stress or nutrient deficiencies and take corrective actions as needed.

By implementing these management practices, you can reduce the incidence of pitting disease in banana crops.

messages.content:
आपल्या बाणानाच्या पिकात "पिवळा आणि काळा सिगाटोका" रोगाची शक्यता आहे. या रोगाचे लक्षणे खालीलप्रमाणे आहेत:

- पहिल्यांदा, पानांवर तपकिरी ठिपके.
- पानांच्या शिरांच्या समांतर, अरुंद, गडद पट्टे आणि पिवळा हॅलो.
- मोठ्या नाशक क्षेत्रे.

### उपचार:
1. **फंगिसाइड्स**: मॅन्कोजेब, कॅलिक्सिन किंवा क्लोरोथालोनिल यांसारख्या फंगिसाइड्सचा वापर करा. हे फोलिअर स्प्रे म्हणून लागू करावे.
2. **सिस्टमेटिक फंगिसाइड्स**: प्रोपिकोनाझोल, फेनबुकोनाझोल किंवा अझोक्सिस्ट्रोबिन यांसारख्या फंगिसाइड्सची रोटेशन करा. हे रोगाच्या वाढीला प्रतिबंध करण्यास मदत करेल.

सर्व उपाययोजना एकत्रितपणे वापरणे आणि जैविक उपचारांचा विचार करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे.

faq:
Q: What are mixed fertilizers (NPK)?
A: NPK fertilizers are represented by a three-number sequence, such as 10-10-10, indicating the percentage by weight of each nutrient. For example, 10-10-10 means the fertilizer contains 10% Nitrogen, 10% Phosphorus, and 10% Potassium elements in the chemical mixture. Some examples are below:
0-40-37, 0-40-40, 0-49-32, 0-52-34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0-55-18, 0-60-20, 0-9-46, 10-26-26, 10-54-10, 11-44-11, 12-11-18, 12-32-16, 12-61-0, 13-0-45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13-40-13, 19-19-19, 20-20-0-13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24-24-0, 30-10-10, 6-34-17
Or 0:40:37, 0:40:40, 0:49:32, 0:52:34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0:55:18, 0:60:20, 0:9:46, 10:26:26, 10:54:10, 11:44:11, 12:11:18, 12:32:16, 12:61:0, 13:0:45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13:40:13, 19:19:19, 20:20:0:13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24:24:0, 30:10:10, 6:34:17
Or 0.40.37, 0.40.40, 0.49.32, 0.52.34 (Mono potassium phosphate), 0.55.18, 0.60.20, 0.9.46, 10.26.26, 10.54.10, 11.44.11, 12.11.18, 12.32.16, 12.61.0, 13.0.45 (Potassium Nitrate), 13.40.13, 19.19.19, 20.20.0.13 (Ammonium Phosphate Sulphate), 24.24.0, 30.10.10, 6.34.17

Q: Do I need to do fertigation on my farm?
A: Fyllo provides a fixed fertigation schedule based on plot and crop details, along with weather forecasting data for farmer plots, to decide the fertilizer/fertigation needs.

Q: Does Fyllo provide a fertigation schedule?
A: Yes, Fyllo provides a fertigation schedule for users.

messages.content:
आपल्या "Gopalwad Thomson" प्लॉटमध्ये सध्या "Beginning of Bloom" (फुलांचा प्रारंभ) या अवस्थेत आहात, जी 2024-10-11 पासून सुरू झाली आहे. 

### सध्याचा खत वितरण कार्यक्रम (सप्ताह 1):
1. **Mono potassium phosphate** - 3.5 किलोग्राम/एकर
2. **Phosphoric acid 80%** - 1.5 किलोग्राम/एकर (इतर खतांच्या अनुप्रयोगापूर्वी 15-20 मिनिटे स्वतंत्रपणे लागू करावे)

### पुढील खत वितरण कार्यक्रम (सप्ताह 2, 2024-11-08 पासून):
1. **11-44-11** - 6.5 किलोग्राम/एकर
2. **Calcium nitrate** - 1.5 किलोग्राम/एकर (इतर खतांच्या अनुप्रयोगानंतर 15-20 मिनिटे स्वतंत्रपणे लागू करावे)
3. **Sulfate of Potash** - 3.5 किलोग्राम/एकर

आपण सध्या दिलेल्या खतांचे वितरण करू शकता.

messages.content:
### "Gopalwad Thomson" Plot Planning

#### 1. Fertigation Schedule:
- **Current Stage**: Beginning of Bloom (Started on 2024-10-11)
- **Current Week (Week 1)**:
  - **Fertilizers**:
    - **Mono potassium phosphate**: 3.5 kg/acre
    - **Phosphoric acid 80%**: 1.5 kg/acre (Apply separately, 15-20 minutes before other fertilizers)

- **Next Schedule (Week 2, Starting on 2024-11-08)**:
  - **Fertilizers**:
    - **11-44-11**: 6.5 kg/acre
    - **Calcium nitrate**: 1.5 kg/acre (Apply separately, 15-20 minutes after other fertilizers)
    - **Sulfate of Potash**: 3.5 kg/acre

#### 2. Pest and Disease Management:
- No specific pest or disease schedule is available for the upcoming week. Regular monitoring is recommended.

#### 3. Irrigation Forecast:
- **Irrigation should be done on**: **October 20, 2024**, around **6:23 PM**.
- **Expected Rainfall**: 0.47 mm until the optimal irrigation time, indicating low rainfall expectation.

आपण या सर्व गोष्टींचा विचार करून आपल्या प्लॉटसाठी योग्य नियोजन करू शकता.
Spray shedule
messages.standalone_question: What is the spray schedule?
messages.standalone_en: What is the spray schedule?

tools:
check_spray_conditions  
Gets the spray condition forecast for the next few hours for the farmer's plots and returns the condition for each hour as GOOD, MODERATE, or WORST, based on deltaT, VPD, and rainfall conditions.

get_disease_pest_schedule  
Retrieves the farmer's current and past pesticide-related spray recommendations with spray details, based on dates. Dates are mandatory.

get_fertigation_schedule  
Checks the farmer's crop stages and requirements with internal petiole reports and gives the current week fertigation schedule details, and details of the next fertigation schedule (could be next week in the same crop stage or in next crop stage) for the plots. Fertilizers are given by 3 distribution methods:  
- Fertigation: fertilizers put into the irrigation pipeline itself  
- Foliar: on the leaves using a foliar spray  
- Soil: directly on the soil  
If the unit of fertilizer amount includes "per acre", then it is for 1 acre. Otherwise it is for "units per 1 plant".
faq:
Q: Do I need to spray?
A: Check the disease pest spray schedule for the farmer and reply accordingly. Don't check metrics, only pre-defined schedules to be checked.

Q: I already took spray for this pest, but it is still showing high prediction/chances, why?
A: Taking a spray does not affect the prediction calculation. If you have already sprayed based on the fyllo notification,
   then wait a few days, if the fyllo app still recommends spray, only then spray again. Don't give any other reasons.

आपल्या "Gopalwad Thomson" प्लॉटमध्ये केलेल्या फवारणीसाठी गळतीच्या लक्षणांचा अभ्यास केला आहे. 

### विश्लेषण:
- **पिकांची स्थिती**: आरोग्यदायी
- **लक्षणे**: 
  - गडद हिरव्या रंगाची पाने
  - मजबूत पाने
  - उजळ रंगाचे फुल
  - चांगले आकाराचे, रंगीत, पोषणयुक्त फळे
  - चांगली विकसित मुळांची प्रणाली

### निष्कर्ष:
आपल्या पिकांची स्थिती चांगली आहे आणि गळतीच्या कोणत्याही लक्षणांचा आढावा घेतल्यास, सध्या फवारणीची आवश्यकता नाही. 

आपण नियमितपणे पिकांची देखरेख करा आणि जर भविष्यात कोणतीही समस्या दिसली, तर योग्य उपाययोजना करा.

आपल्या पिकांची स्थिती चांगली आहे आणि गळतीच्या कोणत्याही लक्षणांचा आढावा घेतल्यास, सध्या फवारणीची आवश्यकता नाही. 

आपण नियमितपणे पिकांची देखरेख करा आणि जर भविष्यात कोणतीही समस्या दिसली, तर योग्य उपाययोजना करा.

messages.content:
किड़ों का नियंत्रण करने के लिए निम्नलिखित उपाय किए जा सकते हैं:

1. **नियमित निगरानी**: फसल की नियमित जांच करें ताकि कीड़ों की उपस्थिति का पता चल सके।

2. **जैविक कीटनाशक**: नीम का तेल, बैसिलस थुरिंजिएंसिस (BT) जैसे जैविक कीटनाशकों का उपयोग करें।

3. **फसल चक्र**: फसल चक्र अपनाएं ताकि कीड़ों का जीवन चक्र बाधित हो सके।

4. **फसल की विविधता**: विभिन्न प्रकार की फसलों का उपयोग करें ताकि कीड़े एक ही फसल पर निर्भर न रहें।

5. **फोलियर्स प्रायोग**: पत्तियों पर कीटनाशक का छिड़काव करें, लेकिन मौसम की स्थिति का ध्यान रखें।

6. **फसल की सफाई**: खेत में सूखी पत्तियों और अन्य अवशेषों को साफ रखें, क्योंकि ये कीड़ों के लिए आश्रय हो सकते हैं।

यदि आपको किसी विशेष कीड़े के बारे में जानकारी चाहिए या किसी विशेष उपाय की आवश्यकता है, तो कृपया बताएं।

मिलीबग नियंत्रणासाठी खालील औषधांचा वापर केला जातो:

1. **नीम तेल**: हे एक नैसर्गिक कीटकनाशक आहे, जे मिलीबगच्या वाढीला थांबवते.

2. **इमिडाक्लोप्रिड**: हे एक प्रणालीक कीटकनाशक आहे, जे मिलीबगवर प्रभावी आहे.

3. **पायरेथ्रॉइड्स**: हे सिंथेटिक कीटकनाशक आहेत, जे मिलीबगवर प्रभावीपणे काम करतात.

4. **बेसिलस थुरिंजिएंसिस (BT)**: हे जैविक कीटकनाशक आहे, जे विशेषतः कीटकांच्या लार्वा वर कार्य करते.

5. **साबणाचे पाणी**: साध्या साबणाचे पाणी तयार करून त्याचा स्प्रे केला जातो, जो मिलीबगला मारण्यास मदत करतो.

आपण कोणते औषध वापरायचे आहे हे ठरवताना, स्थानिक परिस्थिती आणि फसल प्रकाराचा विचार करा. तसेच, औषधांचा वापर करताना योग्य प्रमाण आणि पद्धतींचा अवलंब करा.

messages.content:
आपल्या द्राक्षांच्या पिकात "आयरन कमी" (Iron Deficiency) रोगाची लक्षणे आढळली आहेत. यामध्ये खालील लक्षणे दिसून येतात:

- पानांच्या काठावरून पिवळा रंग येणे.
- पानांच्या शिरा हिरव्या राहतात.
- नंतर, पानं पांढऱ्या-पिवळ्या रंगाची होतात आणि त्यावर तपकिरी ठिपके येतात.
- वाढ थांबवणे.

**उपचारासाठी शिफारसी:**

1. लोखंड समाविष्ट करणारे खत वापरा (उदा. फेरस सल्फेट Fe 19%).
2. आपल्या मातीसाठी आणि पिकासाठी सर्वोत्तम उत्पादन आणि मात्रेबद्दल माहिती घेण्यासाठी आपल्या कृषी सल्लागाराशी संपर्क साधा.
3. पिकाच्या हंगामाच्या सुरुवातीस मातीची चाचणी घेणे शिफारसीय आहे, जेणेकरून उत्पादनाची गुणवत्ता सुधारता येईल.

आपण या उपाययोजना करून आपल्या पिकाची आरोग्य स्थिती सुधारू शकता.
Ghad bali ka hoto

messages.content:
घडबळी (गडबड) म्हणजे पिकांच्या वाढीमध्ये अचानक बदल किंवा असामान्य स्थिती. याचे कारण अनेक असू शकतात:

1. **पाण्याची कमतरता**: योग्य पाण्याची उपलब्धता नसल्यास पिके गडबडतात.

2. **खते**: खते कमी किंवा जास्त प्रमाणात दिल्यास पिकांची वाढ प्रभावित होते.

3. **रोग आणि कीड**: रोग किंवा कीडांचा प्रादुर्भाव झाल्यास पिकांची वाढ थांबू शकते.

4. **हवामानातील बदल**: तापमान, आर्द्रता किंवा वाऱ्याच्या बदलामुळे पिकांची वाढ प्रभावित होऊ शकते.

5. **मातीची गुणवत्ता**: मातीतील पोषक तत्वांची कमतरता किंवा असंतुलनामुळे पिकांची वाढ गडबडते.

आपण आपल्या पिकांच्या स्थितीवर लक्ष ठेवून योग्य उपाययोजना करू शकता. जर आपल्याला विशिष्ट कारण किंवा उपायाबद्दल अधिक माहिती हवी असेल, तर कृपया सांगा.
